metadata.title: CVE-2023-25746 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox ESR 102.7. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.8 and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
